name: Escherichia coli
description: A common gut bacterium. Some strains can cause foodborne illness.

name: Staphylococcus aureus
description: Can cause skin infections and is resistant to many antibiotics.

name: Mycobacterium tuberculosis
description: Causes tuberculosis, a major global health issue.

name: Salmonella enterica
description: A foodborne pathogen that causes salmonellosis.

name: Influenza A virus
description: Causes seasonal flu and is known for antigenic shift and drift.

name: SARS-CoV-2
description: The virus that causes COVID-19, a global pandemic.

name: HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus)
description: Infects immune cells and can lead to AIDS if untreated.

name: Ebola virus
description: Causes severe hemorrhagic fever with high mortality rates.

name: Candida albicans
description: A common yeast that can cause infections like thrush.

name: Aspergillus fumigatus
description: Can cause lung infections, especially in immunocompromised people.

name: Cryptococcus neoformans
description: A fungal pathogen that causes meningitis, often in HIV patients.
